analysis.summary: Mandatory 72-hour data breach notification for breaches affecting over 1000 users significantly impacts TechCorp's incident response and compliance with DPDP Act 2023, carrying critical penalties.

tasks.title: Update Data Breach Response Plan to include mandatory 72-hour notification to Data Protection Board for breaches affecting >1000 users.
Conduct urgent briefing for DPO, IT Security, Legal, and Incident Response teams on new 72-hour breach notification requirements and updated procedures.
Develop or refine internal procedures and templates for assessing the number of affected data principals and categories of data involved in a breach for reporting.

reasoning_steps: TechCorp India Pvt Ltd is a Data Fiduciary and subject to the DPDP Act 2023, making the regulatory update directly applicable.
The update introduces a mandatory 72-hour notification timeline and a threshold of >1000 affected users, which is a critical change to the existing 'Data Breach Notification' obligation (DPDP-004).
The company processes PII, financial data, and employee records, making it highly probable that a breach could affect more than 1000 users.
Failure to comply carries severe penalties up to ₹200 crores, elevating the risk level to Critical.
